description: '''Robert McElhiney James''' (born December 25, 1939) is an American [[jazz]] keyboardist, arranger, and record producer. He founded the band [[Fourplay]] and wrote "Angela", the theme song for the TV show ''[[Taxi (TV series)|Taxi]].'' According to ''[[VICE (magazine)|VICE]]'', music from his first seven albums has often been [[sampling (music)|sampled]] and believed to have contributed to the formation of [[hip hop]]. Among his most well known recordings are "[[Nautilus (song)|Nautilus]]", "Westchester Lady", "Tappan Zee", and his version of "[[Take Me to the Mardi Gras]]".
